comment: If the binary Goldbach conjecture is valid, then an even integer greater than 5 can be expressed as the sum of three primes: Since ` ( N - 2 ) ` is even iff ` N ` is even, there would be primes ` p ` and ` q ` with ` ( N - 2 ) = ( p + q ) ` , and therefore ` N = ( ( p + q ) + 2 ) ` . (Contributed by AV, 24-Dec-2021.)
